titleStmt.title: W. M. Fisher et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6453

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Thos E Bramblette
Governor of Ky

The undersigned would respectfully represent that at the March ^term^ 1865 of the Carroll Circuit Court Jerome B Dean was fined Twenty Dollars for an assault & Battery -- That Dean and others were at a country Grocery -- on Christmas day -- all got tight -- a General fight ensued -- nobody hurt -- Believing that payment of the costs is sufficient punishment in this case we respectfully ask your excellency to remit said fine --

W. M Fisher
J. P. Beal
T Y Sample
James Marten
W Langstaff
Thos. J. Vance
W. J. Dugan
Allen Donaldson
Wm VanPelt
John. C. Baume
Major McCrack^s^in
J. H. Roy
George W. Dee
J W Campbell
Clark O Johnson
Jospeh Myrick
A F Darling
J Y Collyn
C. M. Crackin

Carroll Cir Ct
vs
J. B. Dean
I believe that the Prayer of the Petitioner should be granted

W. M. Fisher
$20
Remit
20th May/65
Fisher
